Just discovered a pretty big limitation for me...turns out that sharing folders over a network doesn't work at all.  In particular, whenever I try to share a drive or a folder, I get "Unknown error 0x00000154".

I also got a similar error whenever I tried to share a printer over my network.

Unfortunately that's pretty much a deal-breaker for me.  I probably have to use XP for a while longer now... *sigh*

in xp is possible because softwares used to make xp was flawless like nlite (one is sufficient), for win 7 we have to use rt7 lite,vlite ,gimagex,hope someone comes up with better-one 
its rt7lite bug 

SECURITY (Remove it only if you use an Antivirus with spyware and firewall)

- Services =>
. Windows Defender
. Windows Firewall (Breaks "Share Folder" function (Returned msg: "your folder can't be shared")
What do you suppose I should do then?  Is there any way I can re-install the Windows Firewall or something?

Ha, I figured it out!  Turns out there's a virus around that screws up the Windows Firewall, so you can use the same techniques for fixing it to re-enable it in your Win7 lite distros.

To re-enable Windows Firewall, download and run/add this to the registry:
http://download.bleepingcomputer.com/win-services/7/MpsSvc.reg

After restarting, if it STILL isn't working, download and install Microsoft Security Essentials, and restart the PC again.


Interestingly enough, once it is working, you can actually disable Windows Firewall and uninstall MSE; you'll still be able to create new network-shared folders and stuff.

Note that, by default, the sharing permissions might not be set-up correctly, so you may have to go through this process:
http://www.sevenforums.com/tutorials/24232-sharing-permissions.html

I thought for 5 years that no one would be able to demolish the boot up and shut down times I got with my custom edition of XP called Enlightened XPSP2 totaling 132mb, which was there on Demonoid for a few years. Congratulations to you Nilesh, for you have with this slim version trounced the shut down times but the start up times are still off by a few seconds. Best of luck for your future editions and I will be dual booting with your version henceforth. This is the best slimmed down Windows 7 version by far.
